metadata.title: CVE-2018-16858 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
It was found that libreoffice before versions 6.0.7 and 6.1.3 wasvulnerable to a directory traversal attack which could be used to executearbitrary macros bundled with a document. An attacker could craft adocument, which when opened by LibreOffice, would execute a Python methodfrom a script in any arbitrary file system location, specified relative tothe LibreOffice install location.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16858` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

browser-plugin-libreoffice - 1:4.2.8-0ubuntu5.5
libreoffice - 1:4.2.8-0ubuntu5.5
libreoffice-avmedia-backend-gstreamer - 1:4.2.8-0ubuntu5.5
